wikipedia_page.main: Peter Ernest Arnold Montagnon (24 April 1925 – 27 October 2017) was a British Army officer, operative for the Secret Intelligence Service (MI6), and later a television producer. He was the first head of the BBC's Open University Production Centre. He was married for over fifty years to the influential analytical psychologist, Rosemary Gordon. They retired to France where he died.

response: The series was co-produced by Gill and Peter Montagnon; the cinematographer was Kenneth McMillan; original music was composed by Edwin Astley. Gill directed episodes 1, 3, 5, 8, 10, 12 and 13. Montagnon directed episodes 2, 6, 7, 9, and co-directed episode 11 with Ann Turner, who also directed episode 4.Hearn, pp. 20–32

In the 1990s, she lived in Egypt, Lebanon and France. She gave birth to her son, Alexandre, in 1996—the same year she received her Diplôme d'études approfondies from the Sorbonne. She joined the faculty of Bard College's Lacoste School of the Arts program in southern France, during which time she met poet Gustaf Sobin, artist Curt Asker, composer Anders Hillborg, writer David Ambrose, filmmaker Peter Montagnon and other habitués of the Provence region.

In 1950 Rosemary Gordon married an intelligence officer and future BBC producer, Peter Montagnon, and was then known as Rosemary Gordon‐Montagnon. They spent their retirement in rural Southern France where she predeceased him in 2012.Peter Montagnon. The Times, 13 November 2017. Retrieved 14 November 2017.
